en.UI-Control-Instruction: You can use W\A\S\D to move Up\Left\Down\Right movement
en.UI-Let-Journey: Let's start the journey to find the virus
en.UI-BeCareful-1: be careful, the virus is coming
en.UI-1-1: Dr. Brown has just discovered a new virus that infects many different cells in the human body.
en.UI-1-2: While Dr. Brown is still testing and studying this virus in his lab
en.UI-1-3: one of his mischievous students - Andy found the way into the storage area and accidentally got infected with this virus.
en.UI-1-4: Dr. Brown returned to his lab and found Andy acting very strange.
en.UI-1-5: Seeing the door to the storage area opened, Dr. Brown immediately knew his student had contracted the virus.
en.UI-1-6: Luckily, just 2 weeks ago, Dr. Brown has finished his newest invention
en.UI-1-6-1: the “Minimizer” capsule that allows anyone inside the engine to be minimized to quantum size to allow him to study the human body
en.UI-1-7: Dr.Brown came up with a plan, he used the "minimizer", Micronized himself to be able to search for the virus
en.UI-2-1: In multicellular organisms, the body is a system of multiple interacting subsystems.
en.UI-2-2: These subsystems are groups of cells that work together.
en.UI-2-3: They form tissues and organs that are specialized for particular body functions
en.UI-3-1: There are trillions of cells in the human body. These cells form different types of tissue/wait:1//close/
en.UI-3-2: which form all the organs and systems in the human body. /wait:1//close/
en.UI-3-3: Organ systems work together to carry out the life functions of an organism /wait:1//close/
en.UI-3-4: There are five systems that we need to help Andy get rid of the viruses. /wait:1//close/
en.UI-3-5: Click on a system you want to explore and let our journey begin /wait:1/
en.UI-4-1-1: Nervous tissues in an organism detect and respond to stimuli.
en.UI-4-1-1-1: We are in Andy's Nervous system. The nervous system responds to stimuli in the environment and controls voluntary and involuntary actions in the human body
en.UI-4-1-2: We are in Andy's Nervous system
en.UI-4-1-3: The nervous system responds to stimuli in the environment and controls voluntary and involuntary actions in the human body.
en.UI-4-1-4: Look out! We found the first virus.
en.UI-4-Tutorial: Merge the balls to attack the virus. Your damage is equal to the amount of balls so merge as many balls as possible!
en.UI-4-1-5: WOW! Calm down! there's nothing to be afraid of, All living organisms contain one or more cells.
en.UI-4-2-1: The skeletal system provides structural support and helps the human body move.
en.UI-4-2-3: That's his arm's muscle. The muscular system helps the human body move and carry out internal body functions.
en.UI-4-2-MiniBattle: Here you are! let's destroy it!
en.UI-4-2-4: In a human body, the nervous, muscular, and skeletal systems work together to allow for body movement.
en.UI-4-2-5: Muscle tissues in an organism contract and relax to allow voluntary and involuntary movements.
en.UI-4-2-Boss: Hahaha! Your journey here is over
en.UI-4-3-Boss: Hahaha! Your journey here is over
en.UI-4-3-1: In a human body, the respiratory and circulatory system cycles gases between the environment and the blood stream.
en.UI-4-3-2: We're in the respiratory system which helps the human body take in oxygen and release carbon dioxide.
en.UI-4-3-3: Here's another one, let's prepare for battle
en.UI-4-3-4: The circulatory system helps move blood, nutrients, and gases throughout the human body.
en.UI-4-4-0: Currently! We are entering the circulatory system
en.UI-4-4-1: In a human body, the digestive and excretory systems work together to absorb nutrients and remove wastes from the body.
en.UI-4-4-2: The digestive system helps the body break down food, absorb nutrients, and remove wastes from the body.
en.UI-4-4-3: Obtaining and processing nutrients for growth is a life function of an organism.
en.UI-4-4-4-Enemy: we will damage your circulatory system
en.UI-4-4-Boss: You can't scare me. Are you ready? Let's fight!
en.UI-4-5: We are inside Andy's endocrine system.
en.UI-4-5-1: The endocrine system releases hormones into the bloodstream that help a human carry out life functions
en.UI-4-5-2: The integumentary system provides protection to the human body and helps maintain homeostasis.
en.UI-4-Final: Mission complete! We has successfully cleared student’s body of the virus. It's time to get out
en.UI-7-1: After destroying the virus that caused the disease, DrBrown healed his student
en.UI-8-1: Congratulations! Thanks to you, Andy is now free from the virus
en.UI-Chat-Boss: Hahaha! Your journey here is over
en.UI-DrBrown-Reply-Boss-1: You can't scare me. Are you ready? Let's fight!
en.UI-Virus-Reply-Nervous: We will make you tired and exhausted
en.pressContinue: Press the next button to continue.
